Hello everyone,

So I'm having some troubles with my planes.

Based on the screenshots you have provided, I have to say that I think the problem with your planes is that they do not exist.

There have been big changes in FAR.

1) Wing weight/strength is now a tweakable. Default wings are very strong but very heavy.

2) SAS is destructively hypersensitive. You need a PID tuner; Kerbal Pilot Assistant Ã¢â‚¬â€¹has a good one.

Easy fix: activate Dynamic Control Adjustment (DCA).

This feature is special-made for keyboard inputs that lack the precision of an analog flight stick. It dampens your control input based on your current airspeed, with higher speeds meaning more dampening. As a result, even if you hit the keys as hard as you can, your plane won't exceed a certain amount of stress on the fuselage. In practical application, 99% of the time I cannot get my planes to break up even if I intentionally try to force it by diving at high speed into the thick lower atmosphere and then weaving about as if trying to dogfight... and that's with flimsy 0.3 wing strength. While it will easily pull high g's, it still keeps the marker outside the red zone quite reliably.

Finally, screenshots are unecessary, because I just tought about updating FAR yesterday...

Now my planes are flying well again

Sorry for the inconvenience.
